trial_identification.studytitle: RCT of supplementary home biofeedback guided exercises in the treatment of faecal incontinence
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomized study to evaluate the effects of supplementary home biofeedback guided pelvic floor and anal squeeze exercises in the treatment of faecal incontinence to reduce bowel leakage and improve patient quality of life

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: 2. Home trainer. Assessment and evaluation above. Biofeedback training (2 sessions) using home trainer. Home exercise practice (4 weeks) using home trainer once per day.
interventions.comparator: 1. Standard care (assessment, 2 sessions of biofeedback training, 4 weeks home practice, final review and evaluation) using clinic mannometric equipment

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Participants surveyed after consenting to participate prior to treatment in session 1 and after completing therapy 6 weeks/42 days later at the end of session 4.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Participants surveyed after consenting to participate prior to treatment in session 1 and after completing therapy 6 weeks/42 days later at the end of session 4.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Faecal incontinence; show some increase in anal sphincter pressure during voluntary squeeze; are able to perceive a distended rectal balloon at a threshold of <150cc; are capable of understanding and of cooperating; and are willing to participate.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Children (Under 18); patients with: gastro-intestinal stoma, self reported pregnancy, latex allergy, terminal illness, rectal prolapse, mental illness (by medication type) or serious anal deformity.
